newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end down, nervous ahead of settlement.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end down, nervous ahead of settlement.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed mostly lower on Thursday, with participants cautious ahead of the settlement of September futures and options on Friday. Worries about the domestic economy and a lack of political measures to shore it up clouded the market, brokers said.
The key 225-share Nikkei average closed off 127.11 points or 0.62 percent at 20,443.93. But its December futures gained 10 points to end at 20,600.
"There were vague fears ahead of settlement and that kept people from moving actively," said Tetsuya Ishijima, chief strategist at Okasan Securities Co Ltd.
